main.name: Sukhbir Sekhon
main.bio: Hi! I am Sukhbir Sekhon. (Try pronouncing my name) Well, there are a lot of things that I can talk about myself, but I want to start by telling you a little bit about my background. I was born in India and came to the United States at the age of 16. For 16 years, I lived in a competitive environment under a lot of pressure to get admission to the best engineering college. Long story short, I never completed my high school graduation in India and came to the US to continue my further education. I always wanted to pursue Mechanical Engineering, but I decided to pursue Information Technology in Software Development to learn and understand various aspects of technology.
main.bio2: So here I am pursuing double majors in Information Technology and MBA from the University of Cincinnati. I am currently working as a Software Developer and gaining valuable full stack developing experience from wonderful mentors. I am always looking forward to meeting wonderful tech-savvy people and expand my horizon in IT. You might wonder, why an MBA? Well, I have a lot of entrepreneur aspirations and at some point, in my career, I want to start my own business and move towards the business quadrant from the employee quadrant.
main.bio3: My goals are straight forward. Get good grades in college, gain valuable technical experience from my co-ops and internships, attain Microsoft certifications, invest and save money, and work with a big tech company, live a healthier lifestyle, spend time with family, make healthy relationships, and achieve fulfillment in whatever I do. I hope to make a positive impact on my society by solving real-world problems with the help of a technical mindset. I love to teach and educate my peers using my technical knowledge whether it is in college or at my workplace. I will continue helping others through whatever means I can!
main.contactmessage: Once a wise man told me, 'You don't need a parachute to go skydiving. You need a parachute to go skydiving twice.' If you don't understand it, no worry, contact me and I will tell you the meaning.

education.school: University of Cincinnati (Linder College of Business)

work.title: Software Developer | Intern
work.description: Performs mock testing extensively throughout the code. Migrated iText (Library for manipulating pdf) older version (5) to a newer version (7) library throughout the project. Lead project team of interns to create a java app to extract email data and UIPath (Robotic Process Automation) to automate the process. Created an AI process system using Azure during code jam for incoming medical records to start a claim process.

work.title: Student Worker | DevOps
work.description: Deployed web application using continuous/automation tool drone.io. Dockerized web application by building docker images and containers based on customized dockerfiles. Managed multiple Linux Suse Sle 12 web servers and monitor deployment process. Setup compatible ELK logging system for multiple web services to monitor performance of microservices. Setup servers from scratch to make it compatible for deploying web applications.
